column4: Hi guys.. I don't know why I have no tar application installed
Is there any way to reinstall tar?
All my updates are failing because of that
I think the repositories for this version is simply no longer supported, it is not LTS>
What am I going to do now?
I don't want to reinstall ubuntu just because of that.
There is no deb package or a bin to install tar?

You can do as genii-around suggests, but using an unsupported release is a bad idea from my point of view. Why not to upgrade to 10.04? It is LTS, which means that you will get security updates and support until 2013.
I have 11.04 already.
Oh, sorry.
I guess I did something terrible and I deleted the file or something like that.
Can you simply install it back via synaptic?
Well, what are you trying to do?
Run in terminal 'sudo apt-get install tar', without quotes.
Okay. Open the Software Center and the search for 'tar'.
Be sure to click on 'Show technical items'.
Since 'tar' is technical.
And what you were trying to do when you received that error?
WHAT exactly were you trying to do when you have got that error?
I would more readily believe in 'path not executable', rather than in 'tar absent'.
This situation is paradoxical. Since tar will be packed in the .deb, you will need it to install it.
I suggest you get an Ubuntu Live CD, boot from it and repair it from there.
